poem:
**Jackson Hole**

In the Wyoming air,  
Jerome Powell stands,  
a conductor before an invisible orchestra,  
with the weight of clouds and numbers,  
ignoring the distant echo of demands.  
He speaks to the gusts,  
to the hawks and the doves,  
his words a cycle of seasons,  
soundtracked by unseen currencies,  
windswept over grasslands.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Fed chair Powell to give high-stakes speech at Jackson Hole amid Trump attacks For months, the Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, has ignored demands from Donald Trump to cut interest rates and defied the US president’s calls to resign. On Friday, as Trump ramps up his extraordinary attack on the central bank’s independence, Powell will set out where he thinks the world’s largest economy is headed in a closely scrutinized speech at the Jackson Hole". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Fed chair Powell to give high-stakes speech at Jackson Hole amid Trump attacks For months, the Federal Reserve chair, Jerome Powell, has ignored demands from Donald Trump to cut interest rates and defied the US president’s calls to resign.
